interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions.
India is the world's largest democracy and is known for its rich cultural diversity and historic landmarks like the Taj Mahal.
The United States is home to the world's most diverse culture and the iconic Statue of Liberty.
Japan is known for its advanced technology and rich traditions, like tea ceremonies and cherry blossoms.
Germany is famous for its Oktoberfest, a world-renowned beer festival.
South Africa is known for its diverse wildlife and stunning natural landscapes, including Kruger National Park.
Italy is home to the Colosseum, an iconic symbol of the Roman Empire and one of the world's most famous landmarks.
Canada is the second-largest country in the world by land area and is known for its natural beauty, including Banff National Park.
The United Kingdom is known for its royal family, historic landmarks like Buckingham Palace, and cultural influence worldwide.
Mexico is famous for its ancient Mayan and Aztec civilizations, as well as the delicious cuisine like tacos and guacamole.
Argentina is known for its tango music and dance, as well as its passion for soccer.
South Korea is a leader in technology, known for companies like Samsung and Hyundai, as well as its vibrant pop culture.
